abstract: International Cycling Union fines Femke Van den Driessche $20,500 and orders her to pay its legal costs and to return prize money dating to Oct 2015 for using hidden electric motor in bike.

headline.print_headline: Use of Motor Results in Ban and Fine for Belgian Cyclist
headline.main: Use of Motor Results in Ban and Fine for a Belgian Cyclist

snippet: Riding for her national team in a cyclocross race in January, Femke van den Driessche, 19, was found to have a small motor and battery in the frame of her bike that was controlled by a switch hidden under its handlebar tape.
lead_paragraph: Riding for her national team in a cyclocross race in January, Femke van den Driessche, 19, was found to have a small motor and battery in the frame of her bike that was controlled by a switch hidden under its handlebar tape.
